statement:
Let $K$ be a compact subset of $\mathbb{C}$, and let $E$ be a subset of
$\mathbb{C}_\infty=\mathbb{C}\cup\{\infty\}$ (the extended complex
plane) which intersects every connected component of
$\mathbb{C}_\infty-K$. If $f$ is an analytic function in an open set
containing $K$, given $\varepsilon>0$, there is a rational function
$R(z)$ whose only poles are in $E$, such that $|f(z)-R(z)|<\varepsilon$
for all $z\in K$.
